oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Taylor Jefferson (T. J.) Box, Part 2
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Audio files of Henderson County resident T.J. Box, "Uncle Jake," recorded as part of the Tennessee State Parks Folklife Project. Box relates details of his personal history and travels, recounts baseball stories, and supplies recitations and unaccompanied old time music vocals.

During the course of his life, Box pursued agricultural work, migrant work, work in a canning plant, and life insurance. His travels took him to California, Florida, Alabama, and Arkansas. Born in Lawrence County, Tennessee, he would eventually come back to the state of his birth and reside in the Blue Goose Community, outside Lexington, Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Parks Folklife Project Collection, 1979-1984
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Family histories; Photographs; Recitations; Vocal ensembles, Unaccompanied; Old-time music
Cotton; Cotton industry
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Orr, Jay
